main event: A bright, high-altitude object with a white vapor trail was observed by several pilots near Benton, Pennsylvania on November 11, 1957.
interesting points: The object was described as the size of a dime held at arm's length, with a brilliant explosion and slight glow.
The object's path was slightly downward from northwest to southeast before the explosion.
The observation only lasted for a few seconds.
The object was higher than normal for an aircraft, leading to the conclusion that it was an 'unknown' object.
Several pilots from different airlines reported the sighting, including Alleghany and Capital airlines.
sighted object: a bright, high-altitude object with a white vapor trail
